dt: {bc}marked by free, forthright, and sincere expression

pt: {sc}frank{/sc} {sc}candid{/sc} {sc}open{/sc} {sc}plain{/sc} mean showing willingness to tell what one feels or thinks. {sc}frank{/sc} stresses lack of shyness or secretiveness or of evasiveness from considerations of tact or expedience.
{sc}candid{/sc} suggests expression marked by sincerity and honesty especially in offering unwelcome criticism or opinion.
{sc}open{/sc} implies frankness but suggests more indiscretion than {sc}frank{/sc} and less earnestness than {sc}candid{/sc}.
{sc}plain{/sc} suggests outspokenness and freedom from affectation or subtlety in expression.

et: Middle English, free, from Anglo-French {it}franc{/it}, from Medieval Latin {it}francus{/it}, from Late Latin {it}Francus{/it} Frank
shortdef: marked by free, forthright, and sincere expression
